settings.question: CyberWeek Offer Details 11/25-11/28
settings.answer: Free shipping on gloves & mittens. Free conditioner on orders over $200 (must add conditioner to cart). Offer Valid 11/25 - 11/28.  Excludes Bespoke, gift cards, and custom items. Free Shipping is available for domestic shipping only.

settings.question: How long will my gloves last?
settings.answer: Hard sayin' not knowin'. We don’t know how hard you work or what kind of dumb stuff you'll be doing in them. What we do know is that our gloves outlast hardware store gloves about 5 pairs to 1.

settings.question: Do you have a guarantee?
settings.answer: We can’t offer a guarantee because our gloves are a handmade wearable product. Eventually, by wear and tear or pterodactyl, they'll wear out. We take a lot of pride in what we do and we do it really well, so we want you to be satisfied. If you think you did not receive a good value from your gloves get in touch and we'll do what we can to make the situation right.

settings.question: Do you offer repairs?
settings.answer: Sure do. Head on over here to learn how to initiate a repair.

settings.question: I lost one of my gloves :(
settings.answer: We sell single gloves in all styles.

settings.question: How do I take care of my gloves?
settings.answer:
A bit of occasional glove love goes a long way.

It depends how hard you run them and what you're doing but eventually your gloves will dry out and need an oil change. This is a good time to condition them.

If you're working or playing in wet environments, you can waterproof them (after conditioning) for an added layer of protection.

settings.question: Do you have to use conditioner before wearing?
settings.answer: Nope! Not required. Some people like to use it at first. Some people don't.

settings.question: How do I make my gloves water resistant?
settings.answer: Using Skidmore's Beeswax Waterproofer, of course. Start by warming up your gloves in the oven. This opens up the pores of the leather. Then rub beeswax all over the gloves. ALL OVER. Put them back in the oven to help the wax set into the leather. Repeat three times for wicked good coverage. Repeat the entire process anytime you need more waterproofage.

settings.question: Can I use both conditioner and beeswax?
settings.answer: You bet. In fact your gloves prefer it. Just make sure to use the conditioner first, as the beeswax makes an impenetrable shield around the glove, and we want that conditioner to soak deep.

settings.question: How do I clean my gloves?
settings.answer: Honestly, we never do. The grit, gouges & patina are part of your story and will make you look really cool on the internet. If you are going to the opera and absolutely must clean them, use saddle soap. If you've just cleaned your saddle and are fresh out, you can use a bit of dish soap and water as a backup. Use an old (or your enemy's) toothbrush to clean seams and hard to reach spots.

settings.question: What type of leather is used?
Where does the leather come from?
settings.answer: Our leather comes from North America. The majority (~85%) comes from the New England and Tri-State area while the balance (~15%) comes from Quebec and Ontario.

settings.question: How warm are the gloves when worn with liners?
settings.answer: Quite warm. Depends where in the world you are and how warm your hands run.

settings.question: What if the gloves don’t fit?
settings.answer: Head on over to our Returns & Exchanges page and initiate a swaperoo.

settings.question: Why do the color of my gloves look different from your website photo?
settings.answer: Goat leather is a natural material that comes from goats. Like butterflies or fingerprints, no two goats are exactly alike. We do our best to standardize the color of the hides we use, there is an inevitable amount of variation among the color of hides. We celebrate that every pair of gloves we make is unique. Once you've worn them in, the patina, look and feel is entirely yours.
